1: %% @doc Common Test suite for router_result_consumer
    2: -module(router_result_consumer_SUITE).
    3: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    4: %% Note: this suite does not use records/macros from beamline_router.hrl; remove include to avoid compile-time path issues.
    5: 
    6: -export([all/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
    7: -export([
    8:     test_result_parsing/1,
    9:     test_result_correlation/1,
   10:     test_usage_emission/1,
   11:     test_result_validation/1,
   12:     test_malformed_json/1,
   13:     test_missing_fields/1
   14: ]).
   15: 
   16: %% Helper functions for bounded waits
   17: -export([
   18:     wait_for_app_start/2,
   19:     wait_for_meck_call/4,
   20:     wait_for_no_meck_call/4
   21: ]).
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [
   25:         test_result_parsing,
   26:         test_result_correlation,
   27:         test_usage_emission,
   28:         test_result_validation,
   29:         test_malformed_json,
   30:         test_missing_fields
   31:     ].
   32: 
   33: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   34:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),
   35:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_enabled, false),
   37:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, nats_mode, mock),
   38:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, result_subject, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>),
   39:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, usage_subject, <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">>),
   40:     case application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router) of
   41:         {ok, _} ->
   42:             %% Wait for router_result_consumer to be ready (bounded wait)
   43:             wait_for_app_start(router_result_consumer, 1000),
   44:             Config;
   45:         Error ->
   46:             ct:fail("Failed to start beamline_router: ~p", [Error])
   47:     end.
   48: 
   49: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: %% @doc Wait for application process to be ready (bounded polling)
   54: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs) ->
   55:     wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs, 10).
   56: 
   57: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
   58:     case whereis(ProcessName) of
   59:         undefined ->
   60:             timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   61:             wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs);
   62:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
   63:             %% Process exists, verify it's alive
   64:             case is_process_alive(Pid) of
   65:                 true -> ok;
   66:                 false ->
   67:                     timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   68:                     wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   69:             end
   70:     end;
   71: wait_for_app_start(ProcessName, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
   72:     ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p to start", [ProcessName]).
   73: 
   74: %% @doc Wait for meck function to be called (bounded polling)
   75: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs) ->
   76:     wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, 10).
   77: 
   78: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
   79:     case meck:called(Module, Function, Args) of
   80:         true -> ok;
   81:         false ->
   82:             timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   83:             wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   84:     end;
   85: wait_for_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
   86:     ct:fail("Timeout waiting for ~p:~p/~p to be called", [Module, Function, length(Args)]).
   87: 
   88: %% @doc Wait and verify that meck function was NOT called (bounded polling)
   89: wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs) ->
   90:     wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, 10).
   91: 
   92: wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs, IntervalMs) when MaxWaitMs > 0 ->
   93:     case meck:called(Module, Function, Args) of
   94:         true ->
   95:             ct:fail("Unexpected call to ~p:~p/~p", [Module, Function, length(Args)]);
   96:         false ->
   97:             timer:sleep(IntervalMs),
   98:             wait_for_no_meck_call(Module, Function, Args, MaxWaitMs - IntervalMs, IntervalMs)
   99:     end;
  100: wait_for_no_meck_call(_Module, _Function, _Args, _MaxWaitMs, _IntervalMs) ->
  101:     %% Timeout reached, function was not called (expected)
  102:     ok.
  103: 
  104: %% Test: Parse valid ExecResult
  105: test_result_parsing(_Config) ->
  106:     Result = #{
  107:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-123">>,
  108:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-456">>,
  109:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  110:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  111:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  112:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  113:         <<"cost">> => 0.012,
  114:         <<"trace_id">> => <<"tr-789">>,
  115:         <<"tenant_id">> => <<"acme">>,
  116:         <<"timestamp">> => erlang:system_time(millisecond)
  117:     },
  118:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  119:     
  120:     %% Mock NATS to capture usage event
  121:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  122:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  123:     
  124:     %% Process result (simulate message handling)
  125:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  126:     
  127:     %% Verify usage event was published
  128:     meck:wait(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 1000),
  129:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  130:     ok.
  131: 
  132: %% Test: Correlation by assignment_id/request_id
  133: test_result_correlation(_Config) ->
  134:     AssignmentId = <<"assign-correlate">>,
  135:     RequestId = <<"req-correlate">>,
  136:     Result = #{
  137:         <<"assignment_id">> => AssignmentId,
  138:         <<"request_id">> => RequestId,
  139:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  140:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  141:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  142:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  143:         <<"cost">> => 0.012
  144:     },
  145:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  146:     
  147:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  148:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, Payload) ->
  149:         UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  150:         %% Verify correlation IDs are present
  151:         maps:get(<<"assignment_id">>, UsageMap) =:= AssignmentId,
  152:         maps:get(<<"request_id">>, UsageMap) =:= RequestId,
  153:         ok
  154:     end),
  155:     
  156:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  157:     
  158:     meck:wait(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 1000),
  159:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  160:     ok.
  161: 
  162: %% Test: Usage event emission
  163: test_usage_emission(_Config) ->
  164:     Result = #{
  165:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-usage">>,
  166:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-usage">>,
  167:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>,
  168:         <<"provider_id">> => <<"openai:gpt-4o">>,
  169:         <<"job">> => #{<<"type">> => <<"text.generate">>},
  170:         <<"latency_ms">> => 850,
  171:         <<"cost">> => 0.012,
  172:         <<"tenant_id">> => <<"acme">>
  173:     },
  174:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  175:     
  176:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  177:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(Subject, Payload) ->
  178:         case Subject of
  179:             <<"beamline.usage.v1.metered">> ->
  180:                 UsageMap = jsx:decode(Payload, [return_maps]),
  181:                 %% Verify usage message structure
  182:                 maps:is_key(<<"version">>, UsageMap) andalso
  183:                 maps:is_key(<<"tenant_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  184:                 maps:is_key(<<"provider_id">>, UsageMap) andalso
  185:                 maps:is_key(<<"event_type">>, UsageMap) andalso
  186:                 maps:is_key(<<"latency_ms">>, UsageMap) andalso
  187:                 maps:is_key(<<"cost">>, UsageMap) andalso
  188:                 maps:is_key(<<"status">>, UsageMap);
  189:             _ ->
  190:                 false
  191:         end,
  192:         ok
  193:     end),
  194:     
  195:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}, #{}),
  196:     
  197:     meck:wait(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 1000),
  198:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: %% Test: Result validation
  202: test_result_validation(_Config) ->
  203:     %% Test missing assignment_id and request_id
  204:     Result1 = #{
  205:         <<"status">> => <<"success">>
  206:     },
  207:     Result1Json = jsx:encode(Result1),
  208:     
  209:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  210:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  211:     
  212:     router_result_consumer:handle_info({nats_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, Result1Json}, #{}),
  213:     
  214:     %% Should not publish usage (validation failed) - use bounded wait to verify
  215:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 200),
  216:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: %% Test: Malformed JSON
  220: test_malformed_json(_Config) ->
  221:     MalformedJson = <<"{invalid json}">>,
  222:     
  223:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  224:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  225:     
  226:     gen_server:call(router_result_consumer, {test_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, MalformedJson}),
  227:     
  228:     %% Should not crash, should log error - use bounded wait to verify no publication
  229:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 200),
  230:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  231:     ok.
  232: 
  233: %% Test: Missing required fields
  234: test_missing_fields(_Config) ->
  235:     Result = #{
  236:         <<"assignment_id">> => <<"assign-missing">>,
  237:         <<"request_id">> => <<"req-missing">>
  238:         %% Missing status
  239:     },
  240:     ResultJson = jsx:encode(Result),
  241:     
  242:     meck:new(router_nats, [passthrough]),
  243:     meck:expect(router_nats, publish, fun(_Subject, _Payload) -> ok end),
  244:     
  245:     gen_server:call(router_result_consumer, {test_message, <<"caf.exec.result.v1">>, ResultJson}),
  246:     
  247:     %% Should not publish usage (validation failed) - use bounded wait to verify
  248:     wait_for_no_meck_call(router_nats, publish, ['_', '_'], 200),
  249:     meck:unload(router_nats),
  250:     ok.
